14756: Some of your houses are too far from a marketplace. No one will ever live there if you don't provide access to a marketplace.
14757: Supplies for your people: Provide acces to a marketplace for your [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14758: Hannah is worried one production building can't deliver its goods.
14759: All your production buildings deliver their finished goods to another production buildings, else to a warehouse. If they can't do so, their internal storage gets full and the production stops.
14760: Warehouse Access: Connect your production buildings to a warehouse
14761: Hannah notices that one of your buildings can't access the Trading Post.
14762: Markets, public buildings and warehouses require a street connection to the trading post, else they can't access your island storage. Build some streets to mitigate the problem.
14763: Make sure all marketplaces, public buildings and warehouses are connected to the Trading Post.
14764: Hannah suggests that you keep an eye on your people's demands.
14765: The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they may leave. Make sure your farmers can have permanent access to basic food by building a fishery.
14766: Basic Food: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14767: Hannah worries about your planks stock.
14768: New companies need a lot of infrastructure and buildings for their company town. Construction materials are the corner stone of our company development.
14769: Primary Resource: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14770: Construction Materials: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14779: Hannah worries about your company's balance.
14780: You won't be able to progress further without money. Worse, you may fall into bankruptcy and go bust. Find a way to increase your incomes.
14781: Bring your balance back to positive numbers
14782: Aarhant recommends you to build a pub.
14783: There is no better way to maintain your employees happiness than by providing them with a pub. Currently, your farmers can just work, work and... that's all.
14784: Leisure: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]
14785: Hannah advises you to expand your setllement.
14786: The more employees you have, the more construction options you unlock. You need to keep increasing your population amount to progress any further.

14801: Some of your employees don't have access to a marketplace. All residences need an access to a close market. Else, no one will want to live in them.
14802: Your balance is the final result of your incomes and your expenses. Try to keep your balance positive. If you lose too much money, you may go into bankruptcy and lose the game.
14809: All goods are produced with production buildings. You can find them in your construction menu.
14810: You will need a woodcutter who will produce wood for the carpenter to make the planks. Both are required to establish a working production chains.
14811: A woodcutter needs access to a carpenter or to a storage. But the carpenter will require the access to a storage. Your trading post is the first storage you have.
14813: Residences, market and streets are found in the construction menu.
14815: Your houses need to be build close to the market to have access to it.
14816: Your market needs to be linked to the trading post, else no one will access it.
14819: Fishery can only be built at the coast. The ideal location may be close to the trading post, but it still requires a street connection.
14820: Once delivered to a warehouse, goods that are consumed by your people like fish are immediately accessible from the market. Make sure that you have enough stock for your population.
14821: The range of your market and the stock your have determines how good the supply will be for a house. Make sure that those two factors are as efficient as possible, else your people may leave.
14823: The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they will leave.
14824: Streets can be found in the construction menu.
14825: Houses will always require an access to a market. Market can be found in the construction menu.
14826: You can place streets by drag and drop.
14827: Warehouses are simple storages where all your goods can be delivered. They can be found in the construction menu. But as they are expensive, it's sometimes better to relocate your production buildings around existing warehouses.
14828: A production building can produce goods used by another production building. In this case it will deliver the goods directly to the building using it. It's more efficient to place the warehouse close to the production buidlings producing final goods (planks, fish, schnapps...).
14829: Warehouses share the same storage: all goods delivered to a warehouse are then accessible from all warehouses of the island.
14830: All your marketplaces and storages need to be linked to your trading post with a street.
14831: You can sell your ship to the nearest party by clicking this button.
14832: Aarhant advises you to start an expedition to the New World.
14833: The New World is waiting. The only way to set foot there is to send a discovery expedition.
14834: Send an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] to the New World
14835: When you select an expedition, you enter the expedition menu. You first have to assign a ship.
14836: You can equip your ship with any good and item you desire. Each of those goods and items have an attribute that can help you during the expedition. Try to match the expected threats of the expedition with those attributes.
14837: Once you have decided on the ship, goods and items, you can send the expedition. Your ship will automatically acquire the selected goods and items, then go to the worldmap.
14838: During the expedition, regular events will pop up. You have to open them and make decisions based on your equipment, and your instinct...
14839: To know if your ship is well equipped, have a look at the morale. The higher it is, the more chances you have to succeed in the expedition. Your morale increases with each good and item you equip.
14840: Hannah indicates that your farms have no farmfields.
14841: Farms are useless without fields and enclosures. If you want to grow plants or raise herds, you need to build the fields.
14842: Make sure your employees have fields to work in in your farm.
14843: Hannah indicates that some housing can be improved now.
14844: When your employees are completely satisfied and the house is completely full with people, you can upgrade your house. This cost always a few construction materials.
14846: Upgrading a house can be done by selecting the corresponding button in the house menu, or by using the upgrade mode.
14847: Upgrading has a cost: mostly in resources.
14848: Only houses that have reached the maximum amount of inhabitants can be upgraded, if you can afford it.
14849: Beryl O'Mara supports your military ship production against the Pyrphorians.
14850: Alonso Gravez takes part in despising the Pyrphorians.
14851: George Smith encourages you to defend yourself against the Pyrphorians.
14853: Your fishery will need to deliver the fish to a storage by road. Since your trading post is your island's central warehouse, you should lay a street between them.
14861: Don't forget the street! The lumberjack's hut needs to access the sawmill by road for wood deliveries to happen.
14863: Make sure your employees have oil fields to work in in your refinery.
14872: Title earned by investing the most Influence into Expansion.
14880: Before you go spend it at our marvelous boulevards, consider that it's our taxes only that keep your workplace running. If you want to see another pay day, forget not to pay up!
14882: Disagree? Think again! You invest in flawless services, well-paying jobs and the safest borders everytime you pay your taxes! Be smart, invest in your city!
14884: Cruel invaders lurk beyond our borders and only your money stands between them and your loved ones! Pay your taxes before it's too late!
14886: Stop dreaming, seize it! Wake up and join our troops today! Be the hero our city needs and vanquish our enemies. You too deserve a win!
14888: You should! Our brilliant shores lay unprotected, soft bellies open for the vultures of piracy and subjugators! Be the spear to cast them away! Join our local forces and protect your home!
14890: Alien conquerors are coming to enslave our little cherubs for their evil purposes. Will you stand still and watch!? Enlist now and destroy the fiendish barbarians!
14892: It may be others doing the fighting, but what would they fight with if it weren't for you!? Go the extra mile at work, your production will win the war!
14894: Only by the united action in our nation's war industries can we crush out our villainous adversaries! Turn out more guns, ships and ammunition, repair faster too!
14896: Why do you!? Our troops need arms and support to fight for victory. Speed up production and repair works!
14898: Illness, war and calamity threaten our civilised way of life, but you can put a halt to it! Join your local Neighbourhood Watch today and show you care!
14900: Thousands of hazards prowl around every corner! Be on the lookout, join your local Watch today!
14902: All your neighbours have already join the Watch to protect you and your family from every possible danger. Don't be the talk of the town, quit sitting on your arse and assist your local Watch now!
14904: Brand new findings show a significantly higher value in courage in our soldiers, who will refuse to surrender 47 out of 50 times. Do you belong? Or are you perchance a coward? Answer these simple questions and find out.
14906: Armed conflict "very close to conclusion" according to reliable sources, victory guaranteed if and only if our brave men and women on the barricades stand tall and strong against repulsive pillagers.
14908: Latest reports on our enemies suggest they regularly enjoy the consumption of living human flesh! Local professor surmises they harvest their contenders! Don't take a bite from the cannibal invaders!
14910: Compares your military ships and harbor defenses.
14914: [AssetData([NotificationContext CharacterGUID]) Text] offers you a non-aggression pact.
14915: [AssetData([NotificationContext CharacterGUID]) Text] offers you a non-aggression pact.
14916: [AssetData([NotificationContext CharacterGUID]) Text] accepts your non-aggression pact.
14917: [AssetData([NotificationContext CharacterGUID]) Text] accepts your non-aggression pact.

14926: The non-aggression pact with !xyz has ended.
14929: Anger at living conditions in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Residents on verge of drastic action to end hardship! Our newspaper maintains responsibility to report the grievous situation of the people, though our livelihoods may suffer for it!
14931: Local hearts filled with woe in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Streets wet with tears, as residents weep for the neglect! "I still want to believe in this place," says one we met, "But the dream is dying!"
14933: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is a dull, occasionally satisfactory place to live, according to residents. Why is this town so run-of-the-mill, when it could be so very much more? We detail in full pp. 3-7 exactly what makes life here so bland...
14935: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is quite full of mirth! "Eight and three-fifths from ten is how I score my present feeling," one resident remarked during recent census, "yet I am not completely delirious..."
14937: Happier days return to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Either people have learned better to cope, or indeed as this paper believes, living conditions have demonstrably improved in recent times. More grounds for domestic optimism pp. 5 & 6.
14939: Mood slumps in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as reality of living conditions hit home. Something must be done to recover this city to former glory! With the assistance of local residents, we have compiled a long list of the most urgent improvements...
14941: The lack of fresh produce available in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is thoroughly depressing! When will the city council see sense and provide the people the variety and bounty of a proper market?
14943: Lack of pub in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is a jolly poor show. If there's one thing that could bring this disparate community together, it is ale, a roaring fire, and a trio of fiddlers!
14945: With no church in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], gossip grows elsewhere that town is cauldron of devil worship. Of course nothing could be further from the truth!— But while there is no church, we shall continue to be branded with the hoof.
14947: Lack of a school in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] means locals are really thick. We can but hope some sentience may emerge from this pool of ignorance, and put things to right by building one.
14949: Scarcity of sewing machines in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has town in a tangle! Settlement hoping the loose ends will be tied up soon.
14951: Still no Variety Theatre in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Local poets spew bitter verse attacking the powers-that-be who would deny them even the smallest of freedoms.
14953: Shortage of rum in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] very rum indeed! Rocky patch for rum sees locals fall from hammocks, and grey clouds fill in the sky. We petition governor to bring the sunshine back!
14955: Fur coats go missing in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Animal retaliation theory disproven, as Town council shoulders all responsibility.
14957: Absence of University in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] makes town "provincial backwater", say scholars hoping to be institutionalised. "Without it, none of us will ever amount to anything!"
14959: No sign of Spectacles in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Locals want transparency with regard to the recent shortages, mystified by town's lack of vision.
14960: Finally, all warehouses require an access to the Trading post to function. Else, no good can be delivered there.
14962: Penny Farthings disappear in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as last few models cycle out of stock. We ask why no-one is stepping up to steer things back in the right direction.
14964: What sane working person can be expected to work without coffee? Is the question we put to [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] local council, in the hope they will grind out a solution.
14966: Shortage of Pocket Watches in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] damaging efficiency! With time ticking on, officials are under pressure to solve the matter post-haste!
14968: Lack of Electricity supply throttling [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] production! Authorities charged with ensuring supply resumes quick as a flash.
14970: Lifespan of Light Bulbs questioned in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as supplies run low. People hoping local council will have some bright ideas for a change.
14972: Continuing lack of Bank in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] has moneymen drawing on new reserves of patience, as cash spills out of bedsprings everywhere.
14974: Champagne shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] takes the fizz out of life. Trust in authorities put on ice, as supply continues to falter.
14976: Shortage of Cigars in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is nothing but a headache for wealthy investors hoping to get their circulation back.
14978: Lack of a decent Members Club in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] disappoints work hard, play hard crowd, who want somewhere to crash when the financial markets do. Ties and cufflinks expected in the post pronto, or there'll be trouble!
14980: Chocolate shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] sends place into meltdown. Grandfathers disappoint grandchildren by hoarding it all to themselves, and licorice substitutes failing to meet with same degree of enthusiasm.
14982: Absence of Jewellery in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is destroying the status of the town, wealthy residents are complaining. "For lack of alternatives, I have been forced to wear family heirlooms on stage," sighed local diva.
14984: Gramophone shortage in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as machines prove too popular. "Music shouldn't be this popular," rants frustrated snob, "Only those who truly know how to listen should be allowed them!"
14986: Shortage of Steam Carriages in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] is driving everybody quite mad! Authorities need to get a grip on the wheel soon, or stymied local motorists may combust!
14988: Fried Plantains run out in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. Cross local remarks "If I don't get my plantains fried in fish oil, I don't know what I'll do!"
14990: Scarcity of Ponchos in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] leaves hill-dwelling locals envious of smug Alpaca. Outrage over missing supply means there is little in the way of warm fuzzy feelings.
14992: Tortillas extremely thin on the ground in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], leaving city feeling flat. "They better scoop us out of this soon, or the whole thing will leave a very bad taste in the mouth."
14994: Still no Boxing Ring in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]! Worries locals may start unregulated fight club of their own if no official venue is organised soon.
14996: Scarcity of Bombins in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] highly unprofessional! "Without comfortable headwear we are lost!" says sartorial snob, his shining bald patch exposed to the elements.
14997: The clay has to be processed into bricks in a brick factory.
14998: One easy way to make fast money is to sell your overproduction. You can select the good you want to sell in the trading post menu and click the desired trade mode, then move the arrow to the stock limit you want to keep; ships will regularly fetch your stocks accordingly.
14999: Select the ship to begin escorting it
15001: Hannah is alarmed about the lack of workforce.
15002: Each production building requires one certain type of workforce: Farmers will work in farms and small handicraft businesses, Workers in factories and mines. If one of your workforce types is negative, certain industries will suffer from lower productivity.
15003: Bring your workforce balance back to positive numbers
15004: One of our competitors has settled a new island in the region, according to reports. If this will spur our own enterprise is hard to determine, but at the least it serves as a reminder of the challenge for resources our people face.
15006: Reliable partnership with [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] deepened with new contract.
15008: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] signs non aggression pact with another player.
15010: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] trades for the last time as debts become insurmountable! Whatever the reason for this sorry state of affairs, it is history now— and hardly a concern for us.
15012: [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context ParticipantName] surrenders everything, as last defenders fall! Sharks swarm over corpse of trading empire, now gone for good. Once the smoke has cleared, we may gauge what all this portends for us.
15014: Sewing Machine Factory bobs into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], producing machines regarded as a seismic advance in the world of textiles! A stitch in time saves nine, they say; and so with the new patent sewing machine— no more thimbles!
15016: Spectacle Factory blinks into life in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. It looks a long-sighted move, with so many opthalmic conditions made tolerable. Why not hold this very article fifteen inches from the eye, and see if it still legible?
15018: Coffee buzz in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName] as daily grind begins! Town experiences flurry of stimulation; our own publishing house has never been so wonderfully jittery— there are circular brown stains all over the copy!
15020: Fried Plantains arrive in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. Locals swear recipe is authentic, which is a relief, because we ourselves would never have thought to fry in fish oil! For other recipes using fish oil, see right at the very very bottom of p. 51.
15022: Ponchos become part of the fabric in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as locals snuggle up in finest alpaca wool, making fittingly soft snuggling noises.
15024: Tortillas ready in [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName], as locals perform ritual celebration of corn. A legacy of ancestors in the region, a staple of liberation and independence, it shall go marvellously with a prickly pear, or a pricklier chilli!
15026: Bombins bowl into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. Hats thrown into the air at the news, then trampled into the dirt, as beautiful Bombins become the new trend!
15028: Boxing Ring punches its way into [Newspaper FindArticle([RefGuid]) Context TownName]. There are no shortage of willing fighters, so popular is the crunch of knuckle on cheekbone; full list of odds and fighters below...

15034: Electricity was a luxury so far, improving the productivity of the factories. But as new goods get produced, electricity becomes a requirement to run their production. 15343: Defend all royal supply ships and destroy all supplies of your enemy.
15344: Finish the campaign on normal difficulty.
15345: Finish the campaign on advanced difficulty.
15346: Finish the campaign on expert difficulty.
15359: Reach Investors using only charter routes.
15360: The display of the splendors of the ancient empire, well known for building magnificent cities and infrastructure. Gathering their remains will inspire safer architecture against higher taxes.
15361: Brought back from the New World's mountains, these animals showed adaptation to life in the highlands, which made the alpaca a very reliable pack carrier. Farmers and Jornaleros can easily take advantage of these agile animals for their daily work.
15362: Majestic creatures from the taiga, usually hiding in the cold northern coniferous forests around the globe. The sight of animals surviving in harsh climatic conditions encourages your people to show temperance in their own food consumption.
15363: Mythical creatures brought back to the world of reality. The true existence of these monsters will for sure inspire creative writers in your city.
15364: The demons from the abysses, the legendary killers in the sea that you never want to face out of their fishtank. Bringing these killers into your zoo teaches your people about escaping sharks attacks and about general submarine animal behaviour.
15365: Originating from the Amazon Basin, these animals from the tropical rainforest show a panel of vivid colors in their fur, feathers and skin which has no equivalent in the Old World. The decoration taste in your city will directly be impacted by this natural artistic show.
15366: The great white desert of the far North overflows with noble fauna of immaculate fur and feathers. The sight of these creatures from the terra incognita will encourage more people to make exploration their vocation.
15367: The exotic fauna endemic to the oriental rainforest, traveled through for ages by merchants of the Silk and Incense Roads. The display of this specific biome will attract rich visitors from afar, leaving some exotic products in your harbor.
15368: These farm animals bring nothing new to discover to your visitors, but for sure enables your people to learn more about domestic animal care and reproduction.
15369: The variety of animals living along the Great Reef Barrier is a source of knowledge and admiration for the children witnessing also dolphins shows.
15371: The dreadful funerary remains of a mysterious civilization from the New World, brought to your visitors. A got-to destination for any leading figure fond of esotericism.
15372: The first steps of our ancestors through the wildlands of the prehistoric era displayed to the public. Brings back basic knowledge of resources gathering for survival.
15373: The soul of formerly knowned terrors of the seas, stealing everything on their way. A new spirit of piracy will inhabit your sailors.
15374: The admirable religious architecture and mythological parchments left by the ancient cities of the Aegean. Your people will want to play their famous tragedies in theatres.
15375: The colossal ruins of the abandoned stone cities hidden below the New World's jungle canopy, where the legendary El Dorado should still stand. Learning more about this civilization may help discovering the Golden City.
15376: Mythological remains of the northern culture spreading fear and destruction for centuries on the Old World's coasts. Their passion for war and fear of nothing may inspire your fighters.
15377: The most important geological discoveries, teaching your visitors about origins of history and life. While serving as open university, your museum's exhibition may also reduce the church's attendance for good.
15378: The remains of a protohistorical civilization, known for its circles of stones and enchanted forests. Your quarries and forests will reflect their inherent beauty to the initiated visitors.
15390: Jornalero needs you to find his missing grandson, Miguel.
15400: Jornalero is forced by his family to have a family portrait taken.
15404: Jornalero considers that the traditions will only be respected once a church is built.
15407: Jornalero would like to build guitars for the whole community.
15408: Jornalero would like to build toys for the children.
15409: Jornalero would like to cool a fresh meal for all the poors in the community.
15413: Jornalero would like you to listen to the story of his life.
15416: Jornalero would like to pass on his knowledge to kids.
15417: Jornalero needs you to find the escaped alpacas.
15418: Jornalero needs you to deal with the dangerous crocodiles near the city.
15419: Jornalero needs you to take care of the sharks threatening the pearl divers lives.
15420: Jornalero hope you can give a letter to a woman he once knew.
15421: Jornalero hopes you can build a new house for a poor man who lost everything in a fire.
15422: Jornalero would like to have a picture of himself taken to put on the ancestor altar once he passes.
15423: Jornalero would like to have a picture a big sail ship.
15424: Jornalero would like you to have a strange gift a pirate gave to his son.
15426: Me poor auntie, God rest her soul, left this for me, but I have no use for it! Maybe a cultured one like yerself would appreciate her legacy propper.
15427: 'Twas a day like any other, ploughing the field, when m'boy dug this thing up! You like these things, don't ye? Don't worry, we already scrubbed it clean.
15428: 'Tatoes for dinner, 'tatoes for lunch, 'tatoes for breakfast, 'tatoes for snack, so many potatoes... Please rid us of the bloody stuff...!
15429: I caught this scamp gobbling all my fish! But I couldn't bear to hurt it. Will you take care of it?
15431: His teeth are crooked as a donkey's!
15432: Ugh, look at his spotless shirt, such arrogance!
15433: Look at those scrawny shoulders! He'll snip in half if he tries to lift two potatoes!
15434: Haven't you seen those dead fish eyes? He gives me the creeps!
15435: He couldn't tell his mother from a sheep!
15437: My pigs! Gov'nor, you need to help me. See, they've escaped their pen. They're all we got, please get them back!
15438: Me poor husband is missing! I am sick worried. When leaving he told me he was going to have a liquid lunch! What is this new fancy that took him?
15439: Me child's a real headache, always messing around with the Jungers' lad. I bet he's loitering somewhere right now! Please find'im for me, give'im a good scold.
15440: Is there no man in this town fit fer me? They are all intimidated by me wits! Ye know everyone in town, I assume? Find me a suitor!
15441: Mon chat! Il est perdu! Please, find my little Antoine, he surely doesn't know his way back home...!
15442: Bloody hounds have the whole neighbourhood on edge. I'm afraid they might bite my little boy one of these days! Lock them away, ye must!
15443: That damned fox is eating all my hens! They are terrified, see? They haven't laid an egg in weeks! Please, gov'nor, help us catch the rascal!
15444: Me pig's been stolen! It's one of the Willington lads I tell ye! See this big 'W' in the mud? Only their fancy boots leave prints like that!
15445: Me chickens! I knew they were up to something...! Just when I was planning to bake my famous chicken pie they all escaped! Help me find them, won't ye?
15446: He... he might do! Hmm, yes, I shall give this one a chance.
15447: Oi, I heard they have sheep with really long necks in the other side of the world. I'd kill to see one! Could you show them to me?
15448: What a great day! Two rival landowners family marrying their children! We're celebrating the union at the church. Peace will finally be back in the community. Take a daguerrotype of the happy couple to prove to everybody the war is over, will ye?
15449: It's this time of the year again! The International Agricultural Show! We will show our most beautiful cows, proving we care better for our cattle here than anywhere else!
15450: Me child's a firefighters' fanatic! He wishes to join the local squad when he grows up. If you could take his picture in the fire station it would mean the world to him
15451: It's a pain, going back and forth to the well to fetch water. If only we had a fountain nearby we wouldn't have to carry all these buckets such a long way...
15452: I'm always stumbling upon my tools! If you would be so kind as to build a shed for me, I could keep them organised.
15453: This sun is a bliss for the crops, but a pain for my neck! I would be greatly grateful if someone were to plant a lush tree around here so we could rest under its shade.
15454: I told Jeanine about the long, yellow fruits from the New World, but she doesn't believe me and now she's telling everyone that I'm a liar! Bring me some so I can rub them in her face, will ye?
15455: I was hoping to have something really fancy for my wedding feast. You think you can get me some of that odd food in metal boxes that the rich enjoy so much?
15456: Have you heard? Winter will be rough this year, they say! I'm a tad worried, we could use some extra firewood to keep the neighbourhood warm...
15457: I went mushroom picking in the forest and met the most wonderful man, but we were so caught up in the moment that I forgot to ask his name! Do you think I might find him at the pub? Or maybe he's more of a club gentleman...?
15458: I waited for hours, but he never came... I guess we were not meant to be... Still, thank you for caring, yer a true friend.
15459: There he was, like you said! He was so happy to see me as well! We will remember your help, please take this with our thanks.
15460: For once I have nothing to complain about! It deserve a gift to celebrate!
15461: We have so much to eat that today my ward Oliver even told me "Sir I don't want more"!  Please take this gift, we are so greatful.
15462: Me pals all work in different factories, it's a pain every time we want to meet at the pub. Will you help me gather them up?
15463: We got lost on our way to the mines and now the gang is separated! Could you find my pals? They're usually really merry!
15464: My boy, he's passionate about the worker's struggle. Maybe a tad too much. See, he's been running around town handing leaflets and refuses to 'be oppressed by his bedtime'... Please help me catch him, boss.
15465: It's always the same with Old Harold! We arranged our protest on the nineteenth, but out he goes on the ninth all on his own. His bad hearing is going to cost us our reputation! Please shut him up.
15466: Could you point me the way to Ah Sing's house? He's got... good ways of making one forget about the hardships of work. It should be easy to spot by the- er... vapour.
15467: You hear of Miss Alethea? She makes damn fine remedies for clogged lungs. But she lives so far in the mountain that I don't have the strengh to go there myself ...
15468: He... he might do! Hmm, yes, I shall give this one a chance.
15469: We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig in our mine the whole day through!
15470: To dig dig dig dig dig dig dig is what we really like to do!
15471: It ain't no trick to get rich quick if you dig dig dig with a shovel or a pick.
15472: In a mine! Where a million diamonds shine! We dig dig dig dig dig dig dig from early morn till night.
15473: We dig up diamonds by the score! A thousand rubies, sometimes more!
15474: But we don't know what we dig 'em for. We dig dig dig a-dig dig, heigh-ho! It's home from work we go.
15475: How am I supposed to brag about being in the fight club if I can't talk about the fight club? Oh, I know! The rules didn't say anything about takings pictures...!
15476: Me mates and I have shared so many things in life. Jimmy's birthday is coming and there would be no gift more perfect than a framed picture of the whole gang in front of the brick factory we work at.
15477: Bourgeois are like pigs, the fatter the stupier! If I am not to be welcomed in their proper gentlemen club then I will make an impression in my own way. Please take a picture of my moment of glory!
15478: My son has always dreamt to become a firefighter. And now we have a firefighter station right by our home! Can you take a picture of him there?
15479: All this smoke and soot takes a real tool on our bodies. My oldest, she's gotten sick as I've never seen her before. Do we have a place I can take her to?
15480: Our work is pretty dangerous and not gentle on clothes. We workers spend evenings sewing them back! If only we had one of these sewing machines...
15481: What is this weird brown thing these fancy people are eating? It looks weird but smell incredible. Would you be kind enough to give some of this chocolate to us workers so we can try it out?
15482: I am a dad! We will drink all night to celebrate but we need better than beer this time! Can you give me a few bottle of this champagne the bourgeois are drinking?
15483: It is so sunny, the ideal weather to roast some sausages and make hot dogs! Would you have some  sausages and bread to spare so we invite the whole neighborhood?
15484: We were competing to know who is the strongest man among us and I might have been a bit carried away ... I punched my wall very hard and destroyed it partially. Do you have some spare bricks for a sad winner?
15485: The taste of beer is actually better ... Thanks still.
15486: I want all my group to look as extravagant as these exotic people from the New World we see on the newspaper! Can you give us poncho so we can be as elegant?
15487: Do these engineers think they are the only one who need to stay late to accomplish their craft? My art cannot wait and I will work all night for it! Please get me some coffee!
15488: I have wrote the most incredible play about pirates! I will give a private lecture tonight to my followers but I feel the mood would not be right without bottles of rum. Could you provide some?
15489: Sails are so romantic, much more than these steam engines delivering black clouds! Please give me some, I would like to create an artistic installation out of it!
15490: We are all blind by modernity! It's only the small things in life that bring us joy! Would you please find a farmer family that would be so kind as to share their precious, simple life with me?
15491: Erwan Grogg's in town touring his drama masterpiece! I could faint in his presence, could you ask him for his autograph for me? Oh, please, I beg of you...!
15492: My daughter is a true spirit of nature, she loves to sing at the hills. But she often forgets she has worldly duties still, like taking care of the shop. Could you go find her?
15493: My illustrious cousin is a pastry genious! But reality outside his baking station... overwhelms him. He just arrived in town and I fear he might have gotten disorientated!
15494: I cannot believe my luck, to think that we would be blessed with Joseph Jaffersen's heart-wrenching acting...! He deserves a grandiose welcome! And I heard he's looking for a fine city to settle...
15495: What an impossible fellow! My apprentice can not for the life of him sit still! I wanted to teach him the vitality of patience for our craft, but he's escaped to run around again! I'm sure you will help me catch the little rascal...
15496: Ah, the hardships of the lowly life...! I... I don't think I am quite fit for this...!
15497: These modern fancies... He'll be broken by noon! Forget it!
15498: He'll only be a burden! We have no time for such nonsense!
15499: He wants to work a simple life? Fine, he shall work! Bring him to us!
15500: O, for a taste of distant shores and foreign lips and the elegant shadows of slender leaves...! Still, I cannot leave my earthly prison... To see that paradise, if only in a still picture, would take my breath away...
15501: My precious Annabel Lee is about to start her journey to enlightenment! She will shine a light so bright on the world when she grows up, I am so proud...! Could you take a still of this treasured moment?
15502: The marvelous joy of discovering the hidden gems of Earth's diversity! Is there anything more beautiful? My family would greatly appreciate a souvenir of this remarkable visit to the Zoological Garden.
15503: It's our grand opening! Finally, our grandfather's dream of opening a factory of our own has come true. I would love to have a memento of this fateful day to inspire my grandchildren as well.
15504: Monsier Dubois wants to take my lovely Rebecca away, but I shall not let him! I have challenged him to a duel and I must win! But... just in case... please take a picture to show my Rebecca my heartfelt deed!
15505: I am hooked on knowledge, I know every single exhibit by heart! Dare I hope for a new one any soon? I don't think I can go without learning new wonders for much longer...!
15506: I have read every book in my library from cover to cover at least a dozen times! I'd be thrilled to share my passion for reading with you! Will you accept this one? It's one of my all time favourites!
15507: Ah, the great warrior cultures of the past, their endless bravery and power never cease to inspire me! Please accept this token of their strength, let it be the inspiration of many more!
15508: It is finally finished: my most delicate work of art. Nay! My masterpiece. Since you have the most exquisite taste, you will surely appreciate my art and, dare I say, make it the centerpiece of your exhibition.
15509: It's my favourite time of the year again, the best craftsmen in town all gather for the annual artisan fair! Aren't you excited to greet them and contemplate their masterful work?
15510: Me poor auntie, God rest her soul, left this for me, but I have no use for it! Maybe a cultured one like yerself would appreciate her legacy propper.

15818: The Queen wants to hand over the Transfer Authorisation for you to pick up Edvard.
15819: With these wheels on, your carts will barely notice any bothersome muddy potholes or loose cobblestones.
15820: Your transportations can now catch up with the industrial race thanks to these steam powered carts! Only a little more expensive to maintain, but very fancy indeed!
15821: Steam is old news! Electricity is the NEW new scientific revolution of the century! Implement Tilbury's line of electric carts and banish costly labour to the past!
15822: Iron Framings greartly reinforce your building's structures to reduce the risk of fire catching up, so you can catch a breather!
15823: Terrible infernos or ugly metal structures? You don't need to choose! These Cast-Iron Doric Columns will help prevent potential fires while still looking beautiful.
15824: You want a glowing city, only not from conflagrations? Our Iron-and-Glass Magical Fire-Proof Architecture will stop any fire demons on its tracks and shimmer like a heaven made of glass!
15825: Need something to call  your workforce back to toil? With some extra care, this old bell should do the trick.
15826: Your workers have trouble remembering the end of lunch time? Stop the slackers' moans with this Iron Factory Bell and get them to work already!
15827: Thanks to the Oxford Electric Bell you can forget about shirkers forever! The still running clock will only require a power outlet to keep track of your workforce hours, ensuring they will not miss a single minute of their shift!
15828: Need power but there's no powerplant in sight? That is exactly what dynamos were invented for! Disclaimer: might occassionally combust.
15829: Generate stable electricity anywhere! Our Steam Turbines will safely and conveniently power up your buildings wherever they are, no connection to electricity towers required!
15830: Piersons annouces his latest invention: the Turbo Generator! Its innovative system of turbine stages guarantees the highest safety, efficiency and power supply the market has to offer!
15837: Your metallurgical industries need a boost? For only a little more damage to the environment, this calciner will improve the refining process.
15838: Your heavy industries will revere this furnace! An advanced smelting process that will make your produce much studier and your worker's lives much easier.
15839: Pricey molten processes belong in the past now thanks to the Bessamer converter, a furnace that will increase the scale and speed of your heavy industries' production like nothing ever before!
15840: Need an extra help in your processing factories? For a small cost, a planer will make the metal cutting faster and enhace production.
15841: Tired of wasting time on metal cutting? Upgrade your processing industries with a helical planer and speed up the annoying task!
15842: You have never seen a faster metal cutting machine! Implement The Cutting Edge now in your processing factories and let electricity do all the work!
15843: Put this millstone to work and lift that one from around your neck!
15844: This French Burrstone will pulverise all your grinding issues to a fine, delicate mist!
15845: The fantastic Grinding Machine Lieberman can grind anything and everything in a matter of seconds! The ultimate addition to your milling factories!
15846: Precise chemical processing call for precise measuring equipment, like this mercury thermometer.
15847: Another ruined batch in your chemical processing factories? This advanced melting point apparatus will rid your clueless workforce of having to guess the temperature ever again.
15848: As far as temperature measuring tools go, no other matches the precision of the Thiele Tube. The frighteningly accurate system will ensure your chemical processing factories perform at frighteningly productive rates.
15849: If your wood production is see-sawing, see to it with this bow saw.
15850: Nothing brings two people together as sharing a two-man saw. Bonding while working works for all of the parts involved!
15851: Why do it by hand when the Vaughan Drag Saw can do it for you? Using nothing but electricity, this unbelievable automatic saw can cut five times faster than any man-powered saw!
15852: Set this trap and leave it overnight. Chances are you'll find something the next day. Then again, maybe you won't.
15853: Some might call it cruelty, we like to call it effective! No beast, big or small, can evade the toothy grip of this leghold trap, and your hunters don't need to move a muscle.
15854: Have a case of scrawny hares? Say goodbye to your hairy problems! This fur stretcher will immensely increase the fur surface of even the tiniest of preys!
15855: Woods are taking up too much land? Keep your groves at bay with these secateurs.
15856: Maximise your woods' efficiency and minimise their surface? You don't have to choose thanks to these convenient loppers.
15857: Introducing the Original Lowe! The most advance pruning tool that can cut cleanly and with barely any effort thanks to its anvil system! Your woodlands have never been more efficient!
15858: Are your farms in need of some fresh air? This plough can give your soil a breather.
15859: This cast steel plough can multiply the toil of one farmer times four, so they have more time for sowing and tending to the crops.
15860: Welcome to the 19th Century, when machines can do all the work for you! These steel seed drill sow your crops faster, more efficiently and probably better than any human being.
15861: Wood ash might not be the most glamurous fertilizer out there, but still effectively reduces the required soil for your crops.
15862: Cannot spare any more room for crops? These chemically developed fertilizers have been designed to extend your soil's prolificity to its fullest.
15863: Bony livestock? With these vitamins, your animals should be nice and round in no time.
15864: No one wants animals to die… At least, not ahead of time! Prevent sickly livestock from succumbing to disease with these antibiotics.
15865: Have you lost count of how many livestock assets you have lost to anthrax? This vaccine will ultimately get rid of the bug and protect animals, population and investments alike.
15866: You have no more space to leave your livestock strolling around? You can now cram them all up in these stables!
15867: Your livestock will not want to go anywhere else —nor will it be able to— in these fully equipped barns!
15868: Still treating your livestock like living beings? You can leave that in the past and make sure they are productively fat and packed into the tiniest space possible thanks to these revolutionary feedlots!
15869: Cannot stand the stench your livestock farms let off? This shall keep it covered and contained.
15870: Manage your livestock waste in a clean and sustainable way by buring everything under this covered laggon. The culmen of hygiene!
15871: As elegant as waste management gets, this straw mixed compost shed will cover the stench of your animal farms leaving only green meadows and fresh air behind.
15872: Your miners won't stop complaining? Add this freight elevator to lift their spirits.
15873: This steam-geared elevator that can lift up to ten tons in one go is the perfect addition to your mining industries.
15874: Simons latest elevator will dramatically reshape your mining scene! Performing solely on electricity, it has no rival amidst neither man nor steam-fueled machinery of its kind.
15875: Easy to operate by even the dim-wittest miner, this medium sized auger is a very useful addition to your quarries' equipment.
15876: Make a dent in your quarry industries with this steam-powered drill press that will easily bore through every kind of terrain.
15877: This drilling rig's powerful electric motor allows it to bore into the Earth's surface like no other machine ever created before.
15878: Is your cloth production fraying? Your weavers will be able to operate this mechanical loom even in their sleep!
15879: Weaving by hand belongs in the past! With the appropriate power source and correct human supervision, these power looms can weave faster than the best knitter!
15880: The speed of a machine, the care of a master crafter! Easy to adjust and powered by electricity, the Roberts Loom is the fastest, most reliable weaving machinery even conceived!
15881: Disarray reigns in your assembly factories? Put everything back in line with this steam-powered conveyor belt.
15882: Haven't you heard? The assembly line is the manufacturing process of the future! This one is powered by electricity and incredibly dynamic!
15883: The Industrial Revolution is now! With this entirely mechanised factory, you will set a new landmark for mass-production assembly factories!
15884: Is your gastronomy a little bland? This oven should spice up your cooking factories' process.
15885: Heat up your local cuisine with this fancy cast iron stove, fit for the needs of every delicious treat-making factory.
15886: Thermo-Electrical cooking made easier than ever with Smith completely electric stove, the latest cuisine revolution that will put a yum on every mouth!
15887: Are your beverage industries stagnating? This brew kettle will make your concoction process all the more bearable.
15888: All you need to add a spark to your beverages is this steam powered brewing machine! Shelves will soon be flooded!
15889: Get your drinks flowing with this electric powered pump! It's system will not only accelerate the process greatly, but improve the resulting quality as well!
15890: Lose sight of the tiny beads and pieces no more using this magnifying glass.
15891: This precision monocular allows your watchmakers to see every tiny teeth and detail, making detailed crafting both painless and flawless.
15892: The most comfortable, precise and agile loupe of them all, specifically fitted for the purpose of handling the smallest, most delicate of materials in watch and jewelery making.
15893: Use this net to comb the waters and watch as your buckets of fish simply multiply.
15894: Exhausted of waiting for fish to take the bait? Just set up this drift net and relax! You'll find a cornucopia of seafood goodness on your return.
15895: We all know the best bits stick to the bottom. Now you can scrap the oceans with the unbelievable power of the Bricksham Trawler, the only fishing net able to tow up to 50 tons of fish out from the oceans depths!
15896: With enough practice, anyone can blow perfectly spherical glass bubbles through this blowpipe.
15897: Do away with the lengthy glass-making process with the help of this mechanical press that can easily shape molten glass in a matter of seconds.
15898: The first fully automatic glass-blowing machine! Owens design allows to blow fifty glass pieces simultaneously and faster than the most skilled craftsman requiring nothing but electricity!
15899: Lend your carpenters a hand with this circular saw, but make sure they follow regulations and keep their own hands.
15900: Plug this circular rip saw to your carpentries and watch it glide through wood, glass and metal alike.
15901: This revolutionary electric lathe can shape wood and metal like dough, outlining perfect pieces in seconds.
15902: This moulds can shape any malleable substance into perfectly even squares and perfectly even squares only.
15903: This hydraulic press will ensure every block has the exact required density, a guarantee for sturdy, high quality construction materials.
15904: No other human nor machine has ever produced faster, more solid masonry materials than this compacting molding machine.

15906: What is a town without golden waves of grain fields? With these seeds, you will be able to make it sprout anywhere.
15907: What is a town without golden waves of grain fields? These selected seeds will sprout beautifully wherever you sow them!
15908: Desperate for a drink? These seed will sprout enough hops to quench your thirst, at least a little.
15909: Desperate for a drink? Make healthy hops grow anywhere sowing these seeds.
15910: Desperate for a drink? These selected seeds will sprout beautifully wherever you sow them!
15911: A starchy problem? Take these sprouted potatoes anywhere and they will grow a little.
15912: A starchy problem? These sprouted potatoes will grow healthy as any endemic crop.
15913: A starchy problem? Export these high-quality potatoes anywhere you need and they will take solid roots!

15915: O, for a draught of vintage! Give these vines a few days and it will be as if they had always grown there.
15916: O, for a draught of vintage! You have never seen plumper grapes than the ones that will soon heavy down these sturdy vines wherever you plant them!

15918: Peppers don't ring a bell? Wherever you plant these seeds, the tasty vegetable will crop up.
15919: Peppers don't ring a bell? The colossal, shiny, sweet bell peppers that will sprout from these seeds do merit for a more alluring name!
15920: Indulge your sweet tooth! These sugar saplings might not be juiciest, though still better than saccharin!
15921: Indulge your sweet tooth with these syrupy sugar saplings! Or plant them and get even more!
15922: Indulge everyone's sweet tooth! Let these premium sugar cane saplings colonise your fields and hearts with their delightful nectar!

15924: If you need a smoke, sow these and tobacco leaves will soon puff up as if they had been there all along!

15927: Dreams of clouds of cotton? Sleep tight after sowing these cotton seeds, for the fluffy results are certainly guaranteed.
15928: Dreams of fluffy clouds of cotton? Sow these selected cotton seeds and watch as heaven arises from the earth!

15933: Unable to bounce back without caoutchouc? These caoutchouc saplings will make the ductile material flow anywhere you plant them.
15934: Unable to bounce back without caoutchouc? Get tacky rivers of white gold flowing from these superior caoutchouc saplings!
15935: Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Take these coffee beans with you to never miss a cup.
15936: Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Bring your population back to life with these coffee beans.
15937: Having trouble waking up without caffeine? Export the fragrant, delicious pungency of these selected coffee beans to put a toasted full stop on morning drowsiness.

15951: Effective as ever, these mortars can be mounted onto your ship to bombard your enemies from above with explosive shells.
15952: These cranes will lift the burden off your shipwrights shoulders and greatly hasten the shipbuilding process.
15953: Your shipwrights will have all they need to repair your ship in the midst of the battle with these portable set of ship repairing tools.

16054: Obrero would like you to find the child in the forest.
16055: Obrero would like you to end police corruption.
16056: Obrero hopes you can reassure Jornaleros that they can take a break.
16057: Obrero hopes you can help her friend captured by Jean LaFortune.
16058: Obrero would like to help street orphans.
16059: Obrero wants to give you a gift for being so good to them.
16060: Obrero would like to distribute the leftover of her wedding to the poors.
16061: Obrero would like to give you an artefact of her culture to educate the Old World about it.
16062: Obrero would like you to sell her mother's necklace to help the poors.
16063: Obrero would like to have a picture of her revolutionary friends.
16064: Obrero wants to publish a picture of the island to encourage immigration.
16065: Obrero would like to show her country as progressist by taking pictures of women at work.
16066: Obrero is heart broken by whales hunting and would like to have a picture of whales to raise awareness.
16067: Obrero would like to receive weapons to send her revolutionary friend under the yock of La Carona.
16068: Obrero wants to distribute bread to the poors.
16069: Jornalero wants alpaca wool to make blankets for those in need.
16070: Obrero would like you to build a museum on the island.
16071: Obrero wants a town hall for the people representative to govern.
16072: Obrero would like to have a machine used in a factory.
16073: Obrero wants to have a book exhibition in the museum.
16074: Obrero wishes you to build houses for the war refugees.
16075: A young boy is wandering in the forest, I saw him accompagnied by a panther and a bear! The community is worried, we cannot leave a child by himself!
16076: Some members of the police are horribly corrupted, beating up people to pay immaginary taxes, resolving to even more violence if they don't. Please, you must act!
16077: The jornaleros are very hard working but ... they are old you see. If you could tell them they have the right to take their legal break I am sure they will be less reluctant to take it.
16078: My friend has been captured by pirates! Please, please help him! He was taken by Jean LaFortune, he must be on his island at the moment.
16079: So many poor orphans, wandering in the street alone since their parents died during the revolution. They need help and shelter, if you find them I can provide it.
16080: You have done so much for us and for our freedom. Please take this gift as a small gratitude.
16081: I just celebrated my wedding and we have plenty of food we didn't touch. It would break my heart to throw it all away. Can you take it and distribute to the poor?
16082: Finally Old and New World can communicate as equal! Please take this present, an artefact from my native culture, I would like to introduce the Old Town people to it.
16083: This is by mother most beloved jewelry. I know it worths quite a bit but I know a lot of people need it more than I do. Please take it, sell it, use the money for the poors. I trust in your decision.
16084: The revolution has succeeded! We are celebrating today the first anniversary of it and the editor would like to have a picture to illustrate his newspaper article. Since you are so key to our success, do you mind taking it?
16085: This place is clearly the best place on Earth! If we were to publish a photo of the island I am sure people would come flooding to our little paradise!
16086: We created a really modern society here, one where women working is seen as normality, a decision taken out of will and not out of necessity. Please, take a picture of us working, showcase it to the world!
16087: These whale hunting stories are awful. People need to understand whales have feelings, experience pain and joy! They are magnificient creatures, please take a picture of them so I could try to raise awareness about their situation.
16088: Some of my friends are still fighting a revolution against La Corona. If you were to provide weapons to me, I could transmit them through my underground network. This would be extremely useful for them.
16089: The war is harsh for Isabel's people, their stocks are low and famine is close. Please, send us food, we know how to distribute it to those who need it the most.
16090: Nights are cold around here and unfortunately numerous are the poors who have nothing to warm themselves. Please send me alpaca wool, I will make cosy blankets out of it.
16091: The people here want to have the same chances as the ones in the Old World! Please build a museum so we can have a better access to culture.
16092: Of the people, by the people, for the people. Now we are freed from tyranny it is important we have a town hall for our representative to work on improving the people lives.
16093: Oh could you use a machine in one of our factories? I would love to see modernity in the making!
16094: I wish we could have a book exhibition here! It would be so useful for educating people and how proud would we be to be the first natives of the New World to read the Old world classics!
16095: So many people are fleeing the war. if you were to build new houses we could welcome more of them!

grown in the darkness, a lady's delight.

16114: What is black when you buy it, red when you use it, and gray when you throw it away?
16115:
A time when they are green, a time when they're brown, but both of these times, cause me to frown. But just in between, for a very short while, They're perfect and yellow and cause me to smile!

What am I talking about?

I run, it runs, I stop, it runs

800008: "A new course must be plotted," insists the ship's second navigator, after crashing in through the door during the small hours. Asked to explain himself, he fancifully blames, "a sudden shift in the position of the stars", as if the cosmos itself were in turmoil.
800013: [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] helps the second navigator correct his miscalculation. In a short time, a relieved second navigator has successfully plotted a new course.
800014: The second navigator can no longer see a problem upon reviewing his calculations. The crew, rudely awoken and ready to switch course, take great pleasure in humiliating him for the blunder.
800015: The second navigator is suddenly ill. He looks skyward and blinks rapidly. Jerks and tremors spread through his whole body, before he tumbles, convulsing, to the deck.
800017: The navigator is thankful and returns to his work.
800019: It's good for the general mood, but the second navigator doesn't take it well. He absconds before dawn, taking some supplies with him.
800021: The doctor correctly declares this to be an epileptic seizure. He quickly creates a space around the navigator, and loosens his clothing. He assures nervous bystanders that all will soon be well, and that they should go back to sleep.
800023: By now the whole ship is awake, speculating both about the position of the stars and the plight of the navigator. This is going to be a long night.
800024: The clergyman somewhat calms the navigator, encouraging him to re-check the position of the stars. He is now not so certain of his initial claims. No new course is plotted, and the rest of the night passes without incident.
800025: The clergyman is unable to placate the young navigator, and therefore advises he be confined to his bunk for the night. Unfortunately, his tossing and turning mean his bunkmates hardly sleep a wink.
800026: The second navigator sleeps poorly, and his incessant tossing and turning mean his bunkmates hardly sleep a wink.
800027: The second navigator sleeps terribly. His fits and screams cause the entire crew to lose sleep.
800038: All Good Things Come From Above

800053: A cry of "Fog!" pierces the stillness, when before the going was easy. Before long all billow has dropped from the sails. Kelp fingers reach up from the deep as if to grasp the keel, and the ship drifts to a stop. Sure enough, a dense fog descends, through which the panicked crew cannot see more than five paces.
800054: [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] invokes the good lord, and the crew are invigorated. As if sensing their buoyant spirit, the fog vanishes almost as quickly as it appeared.
800055: After a brief panic, the fog passes. Some try to make light of the matter, but the more experienced sailors hiss and spit at them, as the ship continues on its way.
800056: A sailor screams with terror! He sees a vast, menacing silhouette in the haze. It is an ill omen, and as the fog thickens, the crew resolve to sit apart. They mutter prayers, or grimly sup grog from their hipflasks. As night falls, the shrieking begins. At dawn, the fog  has passed, and the horror made plain. The few remaining crew count missing comrades  and cargo in mournful silence.
800057: The fog grows ever denser, and the crew begin to sweat as if under the hottest noon sun. Suddenly, a sailor staggers wildly across the deck, knocking away those who would grapple at him. He raves delirious, about pursuing shadows, before finally casting himself overboard. A terror-stricken face is the last of him anyone sees.

800120: 'Nothing to fear from this ritual,' beams the anthropologist, having consulted a bound volume entitled 'Creed of the Monkey God'. 'If I am correct, the devotees gather to disperse the malefic spirit of envy. It would be excellent form for us to join in.' At which remark, the crew begin to look a little hesitant.
800122: Just ask to get some water
800123: Sure enough, the ritual unfolds into a jolly dance. With the shaking of rainsticks, and gentle swaying must come broad smiles, for this is how the monkey himself defeated the spirit of envy. A feast of grouse and soursop follows, and [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] is presented a monkey-tooth amulet as a gift. Next morning, fresh water is collected from the waterfall and having waved goodbye, the happy crew set sail.
800124: [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] negotiates the much needed-water, through a lengthy exchange of sound and gesture, not all of which the crew can be certain is relevant. 800157: Calico's Rogues Snare a Merchant Ship
800158: A helpless merchant brig is being pillaged by despicable pirates. Its captain is a friend to many of your crew, who are ready to die in order to save him. The pirates answer to Calico Roberts - the last terrible pirate - but the light is dim, and they have not noticed your ship.
800159: Ask the advice of your former pirate
800160: Fire cannons at the pirates' ship
800161: Try to board the pirates' ship
800163: 'I knew this would come in handy someday,' the old cove mutters, as he unravels the flag of Calico Roberts. 'They wouldn't dare tear their master's cloth!' As your ship steers into view with the new flag, the pirates do nothing. They fully believe you serve the same master! Your guns fire and surrender is quick. The merchants are grateful and offer considerable compensation!
800164: Success comes quickly. Volley after volley of ordnance so cleanly perforates the pirate hull, it is turned into alpine cheese. The surprised pirates are suddenly waving the white flag, and the skirmish is won. The merchants are thankful to see their goods returned and offer a fitting reward.
800165: It's a good fight in which the crew hold their nerve. At first range-finding proves difficult, alerting the pirates to ready their own guns. But after a few exchanges it is clear who is better-equipped, and the pirates raise the white flag. Although some of the men sustain injuries, the merchants are able to offer financial recompense.
800166: The attack is an abysmal failure. Almost every cannon shoots wayward, giving the pirates ample time to prepare their own onslaught. They laugh and cheer, and shout awful things as your tattered ship is forced to flee in shame.
800167: The courageous crew triumph, rushing aboard quickly enough for it to be a surprise, before blowing half the pirates to dust with their blunderbusses. The remaining pirates drop their weapons, and the merchants are able to come out of hiding. 'A great reward is in order', they say, giving you a generous portion of the recovered loot.
800168: Victory comes at a cost. Luck often plays a part in deck skirmishes, and your crew, unable to surprise the wary pirates, must take many casualties before asserting dominance. The merchants are indebted, and reward your rash heroism appropriately.
800169: Boarding the ship is a grave mistake. The pirates are too quick and already have the initiative. The men are forced to retreat, kicking the boarding plank away. [AssetData([ExpeditionEventRequirement]) Text] and the others are condemned to a no-doubt gruesome fate.
800170: 'We're bloomin' cowards!' cries a furious sailor, as your ship whisks about, and sails briskly from danger. With the merchant ship left to the dogs, the crew fume at such a display of weakness at their friend's time of need.
800172: 'I do hope you've nothing to hide?' smirks the Royal Inspector, as his soldiers help him aboard from the row boat. Sailors twitch. Your ship is certain to contravene her majesty's law, since it has encroached into demilitarised waters.
800173: Show the Inspector a Royal Permit
800175: Talk him out of the inspection
800177: 'Very good', grimaces the Royal Inspector, scarcely concealing his displeasure at having to let you off the hook. His remonstrations with his soldiers as he wobbles aboard the row boat are a great source of amusement for the crew in days to come.
800178: The Inspector's lip wobbles. 'I beg you,' he says, 'I have a gift, if only you will spare us.' Sure enough, the gift is brought aboard as promised. But it is only once the Inspector and his soldiers are gone, that it feels safe enough to inspect the new acquisition.
800179: The Inspector's face pales as he eyes the tigerish crew. He bows, and takes a half-step backward - a signal for his soldiers to disembark with him. Once gone, the crew breathe a great sigh of relief, knowing it to have been a close shave.
800180: 'This is far from over!' the Inspector snarls as he evacuates his men to the row boat. Sure enough, back aboard the royal clipper, he is seen making preparations to attack.
800181: There is a commotion and the Inspector's soldiers are already among the crew. Being exceptionally well-drilled, they quickly force the crew to drop their weapons. 'Now,' says the Inspector, 'if you are quite finished, I'd like to continue my inspection of your vessel!'
800182: A disastrous melee ensues, in which the crew do not acquit themselves well. Some are skewered, the rest disarmed. The Inspector calls three captive sailors forward. 'Hang these men,' he says, and they are promptly strung from a beam until dead. Your ship, he decrees, must leave sovereign waters and take the long way round.
800184: A disastrous melee ensues, in which the crew do not acquit themselves well. Some are skewered, the rest disarmed. The Inspector picks out the captive specialist. 'Hang this traitor,' he says, and promptly strings them from a beam until dead. Your ship, he decrees, must leave sovereign waters and take the long way round.
800185: Set sail and try to outrun them
800187: Slippery as an eel, steady navigation keeps your ship on the windward side, just out of the Inspector's clutches. After a tense pursuit he is forced to give up, to the crew's great relief.
800188: Though the ungainly clipper is outmanoeuvred, the expedition is now many miles off course, and your ship's exhausted navigators must summon all their remaining stamina to get things back on track.
800189: It's upsetting that the Inspector's clipper is near out of sight, when a hopeful last shot finds its mark, crashing in the main deck of your ship, and killing a luckless sailor. Despite having escaped, the crew are rattled by such ill luck.
800190: Complete confusion among the navigators makes your ship a sitting duck, and the Inspector's clipper gleefully riddles it with cannonfire. Many die or are wounded, and the ship is left in shreds.
800191: The last they expect is a quick counter. Surprised and windless, they're an easy mark. Your cannons flog the Inspector's clipper without reply, and before long, it is bubbling to the depths. The relieved crew scout the flotsam for spoils.
800192: Though the royal clipper has it worse, it also deals significant damage to your ship in the chaotic exchange. With casualties and repairs on both sides, the ships agree to part, so that they may lick their wounds.
800193: The speed and power of the royal clipper is impossible to match despite best efforts. Your ship takes significant damage, and a young sailor is killed by shrapnel. Retreat is the only option. Mercifully the Inspector chooses not to make pursuit.
800194: The superior clipper chews through your ship with its dread bank of cannons - the ruthless Inspector intent on bringing traitors to their knees. 'We surrender!' the crew cry, but the plea falls on deaf ears. Once he has shredded the ship to bits, the smug Inspector turns his clipper about, and disappears into the distance.
800195: Allow him to inspect the ship
800196: 'This is obviously a military vessel,' the Inspector says, 'in sovereign sea subject to the amnesty.' He toys with the gold button of his greatcoat. 'There will be severe consequences, unless... I hope you don't intend to offer me a bribe?'
800197: 'Though this appears to be a trade vessel,' the Inspector says, 'Combat was a consideration when these sails were fashioned - unacceptable in Her Majesty's seas. Unless…' he winks grotesquely, '...we can come to some arrangement?'
800200: 'Load these crates aboard the clipper! What are you waiting for?' he huffs to his men. When they are done, he smirks and offers the merest of bows, before sailing away with the plunder.
800201: 'You will remain here until they are dismantled...' trills the Inspector, '...those perverse modifications to your sails contravening sovereign law of the sea.' As the nit-picking Inspector leaves, it is clear an arduous refit is needed before your expedition will be allowed to continue.
800205: 'I don't know what you were thinking, bringing an armed ship into these peaceful waters,' he says, 'but I take great pleasure in imposing upon you. the longest possible route around.' Once the Inspector has gone, the crew look to one another in dismay.
800206: "Rather excellent company", says the Inspector over a glass of port, "I've been dying for something to break the tedium of the sea." Surprising even his own soldiers, the Inspector demands a gift be brought over from the clipper to mark the occasion. Of course, when he finally leaves, the crew collapse about in relief.
800207: 'Very well,' says the Inspector, after being given the first mate's 'special tour' of nothing in particular. He silently surveys the vessel for a torturous moment, before declaring 'it all seems above board.' Of course, as soon as he and his soldiers have disembarked, the crew of your ship collapse about in grievous relief.
800208: 'Save your breath, windbag,' says the Inspector, with an air of a man accustomed to weaselling. 'Show me the damn ship, or I shall become vexed!'
800209: 'You've talked yourself into very serious trouble,' the Inspector sneers, pointing to three unlucky sailors. 'Hang them,' he says, and they are promptly strung from a beam until dead. Your ship, he decrees, must leave sovereign waters and take the long way round.
800210: 'You've talked yourself into very serious trouble,' the Inspector sneers, and points at your specialist. 'Hang this traitor,' he says, and promptly strings them from a beam until dead. Your ship, he decrees, must leave sovereign waters and take the long way round.
800228: The man spasms, eyes rolling, before finally falling unconscious. His mania had come suddenly, with eight men needed to pacify, and bind him to the mast. Some say he is possessed by daemons and must be done rid of. The officers, less credulous, seek a surer explanation. The only way to silence a worsening quarrel, is to find a solution.
800229: Enlist the aid of the hypnotist
800230: Examine the cause of this wildness in him
800231: Try to calm the crew, and pray the man recovers
800232: Guard him round the clock in his cabin
800233: Ignore the officers and get rid of him before it's too late
800234: The crew are delighted the man has returned to his normal self. The hypnotist used a pendulum to induce him into deep sleep, before imparting subliminally, some choice words. Within days the fellow is happily back at work. All are buoyant that such a severe case was so artfully cured!
800235: It is a superb recovery in the circumstances. The examination uncovers a bluish contusion under the hair. 'We are to act swiftly or he shall die!' says the doctor, as he bores a drill into the man's cranium. Once the blood is drained, the resultant hole is covered with a silver coin, and the head beswaddled with bandages. The man is fully recovered within a few days, and the crew greatly impressed by the actions of the doctor.
800236: The whole examination takes too long, 'though a bluish contusion is found under the hair. 'I must act or he shall soon die!' gulps the doctor, but then proceeds to faff nervously through a medicine bag, until the poor man dies on the operating table. 'You did the best you could,' a colleague offers, but there is a hollowness to it.
800237: The patient grabs the doctor's head and smashes it against the table. The doctor was tapping his knee to check reflex, when the devil cut loose. 'He wants putting out of his misery,' a sailor cries, once the man is wrestled to the deck again. So they cut his throat. Attention turns to the doctor, but he is a doctor no more. Injury has rendered him insensible; an eight-year-old boy trapped in the body of a man!
800238: Hellish horror ensues, as the doctor insists on checking if 'ought is stuck in the throat'. As he prises open the lion's jaws, the daemon creature lurches up into his throat. So frenzied is this vampiric assault, that there is little the crew can do but to raise their pistols to the gruesomeness. When the gunsmoke clears, doctor and patient lie dead, entwined and contorted beneath a bloody dew.
800239: The crew are convinced by the chaplain that god has a plan for this man. They agree to bind him to his bed while the chaplain prays for his fast recovery. After two weeks he still suffers gaps in his memory, and a paralysis of the face, but thanks are given to the lord above that he is otherwise his usual self.
800240: The sailors are partially convinced there is a spiritual explanation for his deranged behaviour, but insist on chaining him to his bed. 'He must have done something terrible in the eyes of God,' they say. Despite all hope for his fast recovery, he dies not two days later, his malady forever a mystery.
800241: The faithless crew will not trust this to God, but can neither agree if the possessed man should be thrown to sea, as desired by the sailors, or permitted a chance to see out his ordeal, as demanded by the officers.
800242: Side with the officers and warn the sailors to cooperate or suffer the consequences
800243: Convince the officers the needs of the many must prevail over the needs of the few
800244: The sailors would not dare mutiny, of course, and return to their stations. At first they fear the bed-ridden man will commit some terrible act while they sleep. But they need not have worried, since he dies of the unexplained malady not two days later.
800245: The sailors are outraged and their response is immediate. In greater numbers they overwhelm and restrain the officers, while the sickly subject of their fury is bound and thrown into the deep. Confidence in the leadership of the expedition is undermined and the possibility of further trouble seems never far away.
800246: No officer can deny the logic of the argument, yet, when the man is bound and thrown overboard they cannot help but show their grief it is for no fault of his own, and that none had knowledge with which to better help him.
800247: 'It's a bally disgrace! You dishonour a gentleman!' say the officers, as the man is bound and thrown overboard, 'such incompetence shall be reported to the highest authority!' Not only is a man lost, but the expedition brought into disrepute.
800248: There was little for the guards to report, but occasionally 'quelling the mad dog' with liquor. After a fortnight, the poor man recovers with no recollection of anything, and while his hand is partially paralysed, he is still able to perform his usual duties.
800249: The damn guards are found with sacks over their heads. They swear they did not see their attacker, but weakly-tied hands suggest collusion. Of course the patient's bed is vacant, and he seems to be missing, permanently. After that, rumours circulate, and no-one seems to have any trust in anyone else.
800250: The officers react with disgust to your decision to toss him overboard, and state in no uncertain terms that the whole matter will be reported. But the sailors are quite obviously relieved that his demonic presence has been exorcised.
